bibl.title: [Proposals] 1794 Oct. 31, Knoxville, Tennessee [to] David Henley / John Chisholm
bibl.author: Chisolm, John
bibl.note: This document is a proposal from John Chisolm to David Henley, agent for the Department of War, dated October 31, 1794. The document provides specific details for supplying rations for the use of troops in service at the rivers in the territory south of the Ohio.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
Proposials Proposals made by John Chisolm to David Henley
Esquir Esquire Agent for the war Department__ For Supplying such Rations, in the Territory South of the ohio as shall be requred required for the use of the Troops in Service from the first day of january to the thirty first Day of December Bouth both
dayes days Inclusively in the __ Year 1795__

1st At any place or Placess places from the mouth of the River
Tennessey Tennessee
to Occochoppo or Bear Creek on said River two cents pr per Ration__
2nd At any place or placess places from the mouth of the River Cumberland On the said River to Nashville 4 Cents
any place or placess places within thirty miles of__ Nashville, to the southward westward or Northward there of 12 Cents__
6th At any place or placess places between Bledsoes lick and Nashvill Nashville 8 Cents__
7th At any place or placess places from Bledsoes lick to the Crossing of the cumberland River along the New Trace 4 Cents

8th At at or near the great salt lick & at the crossing place over cumberland River 2 C Cents near New Trace
12 cents
9th At any place or placess places along the New Trace from the crossing of cumberland River to the mouth of__Clynch River 8 Cents__
10th At the mouth of Clynch River 12 Cents that is at the Block houses at the mouth of Clynch

11th At any place or placess places On the Northwestern Frontiars Frontiers of
washinton Washington
& Hambleton Districts in the Territory of South of the ohio from the Block houses at the mouth of clynch to the Virginia line 8 Cents
12th At any place or placess places On the Southern frontier of washenton Washington or Hambleton Districts 12 Cents
13th At any place or placess places in the Territory South of the ohio not herein mentioned 10 Cents
div.closer:
Knoxville
october 31st 1794 John Chisolm
Collonel Colonel
David Henley
Knoxville_
31 October 1794
John Chisom Chisolm
